metadata.title: CVE-2024-43851 linux
metadata.description: In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved:  soc: xilinx: rename cpu_number1 to dummy_cpu_number  The per cpu variable cpu_number1 is passed to xlnx_event_handler as argument "dev_id", but it is not used in this function. So drop the initialization of this variable and rename it to dummy_cpu_number. This patch is to fix the following call trace when the kernel option CONFIG_DEBUG_ATOMIC_SLEEP is enabled:  BUG: sleeping function called from invalid context at include/linux/sched/mm.h:274     in_atomic(): 1, irqs_disabled(): 0, non_block: 0, pid: 1, name: swapper/0     preempt_count: 1, expected: 0     CPU: 0 PID: 1 Comm: swapper/0 Not tainted 6.1.0 #53     Hardware name: Xilinx Versal vmk180 Eval board rev1.1 (QSPI) (DT)     Call trace:      dump_backtrace+0xd0/0xe0      show_stack+0x18/0x40      dump_stack_lvl+0x7c/0xa0      dump_stack+0x18/0x34      __might_resched+0x10c/0x140      __might_sleep+0x4c/0xa0      __kmem_cache_alloc_node+0xf4/0x168      kmalloc_trace+0x28/0x38      __request_percpu_irq+0x74/0x138      xlnx_event_manager_probe+0xf8/0x298      platform_probe+0x68/0xd8
